materials.raw_text: B: 10 g, P: 5 g, Si: 8 g, Tc: 15 g, Ti: 20 g

sourcing.instructions: B: Chemical supply stores, P: Online chemical suppliers, Si: Silicon suppliers, Tc: Metal alloy suppliers, Ti: Aerospace material suppliers
steps: B: Chemical supply stores, P: Online chemical suppliers, Si: Silicon suppliers, Tc: Metal alloy suppliers, Ti: Aerospace material suppliers

1. Weigh each ingredient precisely. 2. In a clean mixing bowl, combine B, P, and Si. 3. Mix thoroughly for 5 minutes using a spatula until a uniform mixture is achieved. 4. Gradually add Tc and Ti, mixing continuously to ensure even distribution. 5. Continue mixing for an additional 5 minutes until all materials are homogeneously blended.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh each ingredient precisely. 2. In a clean mixing bowl, combine B, P, and Si. 3. Mix thoroughly for 5 minutes using a spatula until a uniform mixture is achieved. 4. Gradually add Tc and Ti, mixing continuously to ensure even distribution. 5. Continue mixing for an additional 5 minutes until all materials are homogeneously blended.

steps: 1. Preheat an oven to 1500°C. 2. Place the mixed material in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the oven and maintain the temperature for 3 hours to ensure complete melting and fusion of components.
heating.raw_text: 1. Preheat an oven to 1500°C. 2. Place the mixed material in a crucible suitable for high temperatures. 3. Insert the crucible into the oven and maintain the temperature for 3 hours to ensure complete melting and fusion of components.

steps: 1. After 3 hours, turn off the oven and allow the crucible to cool gradually in the oven for 2 hours. 2. Once cooled to room temperature, carefully remove the crucible.
cooling.raw_text: 1. After 3 hours, turn off the oven and allow the crucible to cool gradually in the oven for 2 hours. 2. Once cooled to room temperature, carefully remove the crucible.

steps: 1. Remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Use a diamond grinder to smooth out any rough edges and achieve a polished finish. 3. Optionally, apply a sealant to protect the surface and enhance durability. 4. Allow the sealant to cure for 24 hours before handling.
